source: Search – Based on Google Search for GitHub Portfolios, README Guides, and Portfolio Templates

level_1: Google Search helps beginners find real examples of coding portfolios.
People search for simple portfolio ideas and free tools.
You can see what other freshers put on their GitHub pages.
Search shows you how to write a short README file.
You learn step by step how to make your work public.
level_2: Search results include free portfolio website templates.
You find articles on structuring your README file clearly.
You learn tips for writing clear project descriptions.
Search helps compare what makes portfolios stand out.
You discover common mistakes to avoid.
level_3: You see how top devs showcase niche projects.
Search shows how to link projects to LinkedIn.
You find tools for clean commit history and branches.
You learn about open source contribution steps.
Results show real success stories of devs landing jobs.
level_4: Search shows how senior devs maintain large public repos.
You find guides on reviewing others’ code in public projects.
You learn how to write portfolio blogs for visibility.
Search results share best ways to mentor juniors on portfolios.
You see examples of personal branding through open projects.
